ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often have you ever been called names because you are (INSERT RACE)?
How often have you felt like you were treated like a criminal because you are (INSERT RACE)?
How often have you felt that your teachers thought you were not as smart or your homework and tests were graded with more bad comments because you are (INSERT RACE)?
How often have you felt that people expected less of you because you are (INSERT RACE)?
How often have you felt that people "talk down" to you because you are (INSERT RACE)?
Indicate your level of agreement with perceptions of the effects of in situational racism within African American communities: Poorer schools because of racism
Indicate your level of agreement with perceptions of the effects of in situational racism within African American communities: Poorer response by the police in African American communities
Indicate your level of agreement with perceptions of the effects of in situational racism within African American communities: Poorer conditions in African American communities because of racism
Indicate your level of agreement with perceptions of the effects of in situational racism within African American communities: Whites having more advantages in society than African Americans have
